text: what does a kiss tell you about the
European Union this is a story of red
lips and red tape
now beauty of course is big business in
Elizabethan times we used to put arsenic
and lead on our faces no longer first
back in 1976 that was the European
cosmetics directive the directive is a
legislative act that sets out a goal
that all EU countries must achieve each
country writes its own laws to make sure
this happens the cosmetics directive
banned certain harmful ingredients from
makeup but since then that --use brought
in more centralised rules in the form of
the e use regulation on cosmetic
products a regulation is a binding
legislative act now with the regulation
EU law drawn up by all of the countries
that are members of the European Union
becomes national law immediately and the
European cosmetics industry tends to
like these standardized European rules
but are they keeping up with the global
marketplace the fastest growing area of
cosmetic sales at the moment is online
and if you buy cosmetics online and the
EU rules don't necessarily offer you the
same level of protection
